affiliations.name: NSF National Center for Atmospheric Research

children.value: In this example, we will make a few graphics:
Comprehensive Temperature Summary for the past 30 days at KRAL.
Maximum Temperature Summary for July 2025 at KJFK.
Average Temperature Summary Detrended (Linear) from January 1st 1991 - December 31st 2020 at PASN.
Heating Degree Day Summary for December 2017 at KISP.
Cooling Degree Day Summary for July 2020 at KONT.
Growing Degree Summary for the past 180 days at KMIA
Precipitation Summary for December 2025 at KLAX
Familiarity with understanding graphics creation in Python
Optional Arguments Used In This Example
Since it is currently winter, we will set
to display a heating degree day summary rather than a cooling degree day summary.

jupyter_data.text: Saved KRAL Comprehensive 30 Day Summary.png to /home/runner/work/xmacis2py-cookbook/xmacis2py-cookbook/notebooks/ACIS Graphics/KRAL/Comprehensive 30 Day Summary/Temperature Summary With Running Mean No Detrending

children.value: Average Temperature Summary Detrended (Linear) from January 1st 1991 - December 31st 2020 at PANC.

children.label: Average Temperature Summary Detrended (Linear) from January 1st 1991 - December 31st 2020 at PANC.

children.value: Optional Arguments Used In This Example
We will want to change our

from the default of ‘Average Temperature 30 Day Summary’ to better fit our analysis description.
Here, we will use ‘30 Year Detrended Average Temperature PANC’
Next, we need to define our

to fit the period we want to analyze.
Date format is:
Next, we will need to change our

is the interval in days the date/time displays on the x-axis.
The default
is 5 days so for a long time period, we want to make this interval 365 to get yearly x-ticks on the plot.
Next we will need to change
is month/day (%m/%d). We want to change it to display years only (%Y).
Next we will need to set
to detrend this timeseries data. Default is
and line graphs look better for longer timescales.
) since the running mean might add some clutter to the image.

temperature.plot_average_temperature_summary('panc',
                                             product_type='30 Year Detrended Average Temperature PANC',
                                             start_date='1991-01-01',
                                             end_date='2020-12-31',
                                             x_axis_day_interval=365,
                                             x_axis_date_format='%Y',
                                             detrend_series=True,
                                             plot_type='line',
                                             show_running_mean=False)

jupyter_data.name: stdout
jupyter_data.text:
Saved PANC 30 Year Detrended Average Temperature PANC.png to /home/runner/work/xmacis2py-cookbook/xmacis2py-cookbook/notebooks/ACIS Graphics/PANC/30 Year Detrended Average Temperature PANC/Average Temperature Summary Without Running Mean LINEAR Detrending
Saved PANC Stats Table.png to /home/runner/work/xmacis2py-cookbook/xmacis2py-cookbook/notebooks/ACIS Graphics/PANC/30 Year Detrended Average Temperature PANC/Average Temperature Summary Without Running Mean LINEAR Detrending
